alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hancock, Rush and southern Henry Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hagerstown to 6 miles southeast of Greenfield. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rushville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 118 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central and east central Indiana.
